intro: Eriogonum lobbii, commonly known as the Lobb's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum lobbii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
